sec.title: American Medical Society for Sports Medicine (AMSSM)
Concussion Position Statement Released
sec.p: The American Medical Society for Sports Medicine released its latest position statement “Concussion in Sport” on December 13, 2012. Read the position statement by going to the following link: http://www.amssm.org/Content/pdf%20files/2012_ConcussionPositionStmt.pdf.
The press release announcing the completion of the position statement can be found here: http://www.amssm.org/News-Release-Article.php?NewsID=45.

Written by a team of 10 experts in the diagnosis and treatment of concussion, many of whom are team physicians, the statement was intended for sports medicine physicians who are specially trained to provide sports concussion care from the acute injury to return to play.

sec.title: American Orthopaedic Society for Sports Medicine (AOSSM)
New Open Access Journal to Launch in 2013
sec.p: The Orthopaedic Journal of Sports Medicine: An Open Access Journal for Orthopaedic Sports Medicine, Arthroscopy, and Knee Arthroplasty will launch in 2013. Dr Bruce Reider, current executive editor of the American Orthopaedic Society for Sports Medicine Medical Publishing Group, will serve as editor-in-chief. Associate editors for the publication will be Drs Allen Anderson and Mark Steiner. This trio of well-recognized professionals will lead the helm as the AOSSM ventures into its first open access publication. This platform will allow the journal to provide compelling research in the fields of orthopaedic sports medicine, arthroscopic surgery, relevant translational research, sports traumatology/epidemiology, and knee arthroplasty while maintaining AOSSM’s high peer-review standards.

Open access journals provide a venue for researchers and clinicians to publish their data in a timely manner and reach individuals throughout the world while still receiving all the benefits of publishing in a print journal (including listing in the PubMed Central database, which we hope to accomplish in 2014). There is no subscription charge to readers, so anyone can access the full text of every article. This publication model is financed by modest article processing fees paid by the authors or their funding source at the time of acceptance.

AOSSM will be collaborating with other professional organizations, worldwide, in the publication of the Orthopaedic Journal of Sports Medicine so that the broader profession can participate in expanding the base of orthopaedic sports medicine literature. For more information on how to submit an article, visit http://www.sportsmed.org.

sec.title: Join Us in April for Youth Sports Safety Month
sec.p: April is Youth Sports Safety Month. To help promote youth athletic injury prevention, host an event or send a letter to the editor in your community. The STOP Sports Injuries campaign has a free event toolkit and letters to the editor online at http://www.stopsportsinjuries.org. You can also get involved by joining the campaign or donating. Simply fill out the online form under the Join Our Team tab and submit your sporting organization, hospital/institution, or practice bio and logo to campaign director, Michael Konstant, at michael@stopsportsinjury.org. We will then add your information to the site, and you will have access to all of the campaign’s materials and a specialized banner to place on your website and utilize in presentations, events, or other materials. Help us reach our goals today!
